docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome to the documentation on how to manage content in Prospectory.ai. This guide will help you navigate the WordPress Admin Dashboard, locate the home page, and make the necessary changes

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Access to the WordPress Admin Dashboard
  • Necessary permissions to edit pages

docs.title: Log In to the WordPress Admin Dashboard
docs.text:
1. Open your web browser and navigate to the login page of your WordPress site. This is typically https://prospectory.ai/wp-admin.
  2. Enter your username and password.
  3. Click the Log In button.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: We've created a generic custom page template for sub-pages that allows you to easily add or modify content. Follow the steps below to add new features sub-pages.

docs.title: Adding New Features Sub-Pages
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Pages Section:

  2. Go to the WordPress Admin Dashboard.

  3. Locate the left-hand menu.

  4. Click on Pages to access a list of all pages on your website.

  5. Add a New Feature Sub-Page:

  6. Click the Add New button at the top of the page.
  7. In the Add New Page screen, under Page Attributes, select Features as the Parent Page.
  8. Choose the template Features - Sub Pages from the Template dropdown.
  9. Fill in the Content Fields for Sub-Pages with your desired content, images, and links.

This setup allows for easy creation and customization of sub-pages under the Features section of your website.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: We create custom post types like 'Career' to manage job openings effectively. This tutorial will guide you through adding, editing, and deleting career listings in Prospectory.ai.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Access to a WordPress website with administrator privileges.
  • Basic familiarity with WordPress administration and content management.

docs.title: Add a Career Listing
docs.text:
1. Create a Career Listing:
  2. Go to Career > Add New.
  3. Enter the title of the job listing in the title field.
  4. Enter detailed information about the job in the Main Content area.
  5. Optionally, add a Sub-heading for additional details.
  6. Select the Employment Type from the dropdown options (Remote Full-time or Remote Part-Time).
  7. Add a button link in the Apply now field for candidates to apply.
  8. Click "Publish" to make the career listing live on your website.

docs.title: Edit a Career Listing
docs.text:
1. Edit a Career Listing:
  2. Navigate to Career and find the job listing you want to edit.
  3. Click on the job title to open the editor.
  4. Make necessary changes to the title, Main Content, Sub-heading, Employment Type, or Apply now field.
  5. Click "Update" to save your changes.

docs.title: Delete a Career Listing
docs.text:
1. Delete a Career Listing:

  2. Navigate to Career.

  3. Hover over the job listing you want to delete.
  4. Click on "Trash" to move the listing to the trash.
  5. To permanently delete, go to Trash, hover over the listing, and click "Delete Permanently."

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Contact Form 7 is a popular WordPress plugin for creating and managing contact forms. This tutorial will guide you through modifying an existing contact form using Contact Form 7 implemented in Prospectory.ai.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Access to a WordPress website with administrator privileges.
  • Basic familiarity with WordPress administration and Contact Form 7 settings.

docs.title: Edit an Existing Contact Form
docs.text:
1. Edit Contact Form:
  2. In your WordPress dashboard, navigate to Contact > Contact Forms.
  3. Find the contact form you want to modify and click on its title to open the editor.

docs.title: Editing Form Fields
docs.text:
1. Edit Form Fields:
  2. Inside the Contact Form 7 editor, you'll see the form fields represented by tags like [text* your-name] for name input.
  3. To modify a field:
    • Locate the tag corresponding to the field you want to change (e.g., [text* your-email] for email input).
    • Edit the attributes within the tag to change labels, placeholders, required status, etc. For example, [text* your-email placeholder "Enter your email"].

docs.title: Adding New Fields
docs.text:
1. Add New Fields:
  2. To add a new field:
    • Click on the position in the form where you want to add the new field.
    • Choose a field type from the options provided (e.g., text, email, dropdown).
    • Customize the field settings (label, placeholder, validation) as needed.

docs.title: Removing Fields
docs.text:
1. Remove Fields:
  2. To remove a field:
    • Locate the tag corresponding to the field you want to remove.
    • Delete the entire tag from the form.

docs.title: Configuring Mail Settings
docs.text:
1. Configure Mail Settings:
  2. Click on the "Mail" tab in the Contact Form 7 editor.
  3. Update email settings such as recipient, subject, and additional headers as per your requirements.

docs.title: Configuring Messages
docs.text:
1. Configure Messages:
  2. Click on the "Messages" tab.
  3. Customize success and failure messages displayed to users after form submission.

docs.title: Save and Update Form
docs.text:
1. Save Changes:

  2. After making modifications, click on the "Save" button in the Contact Form 7 editor.

  3. Update any page or post where the form is embedded to apply the changes.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This tutorial will guide you through editing the title and description of the Pricing page and managing pricing content categorized as 'Enterprise', 'Medium', and 'Small'.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Access to a WordPress website with administrator privileges.
  • Basic familiarity with WordPress administration and content management.

docs.title: Edit Title and Description
docs.text:
1. Edit Title and Description:
  2. Navigate to Pages > All Pages.
  3. Find and click on the 'Pricing' page title to open the editor.
  4. Update the title and description fields as needed.
  5. Click "Update" to save your changes.

docs.title: Managing Enterprise, Medium, and Small Pricing
docs.text:
1. Manage Pricing Tabs:

  2. Inside the 'Pricing' page editor, you'll find tabbed sections for 'Enterprise', 'Medium', and 'Small' pricing.

  3. Add Pricing Rows:

  4. Enterprise Pricing:
    • Click on the 'Enterprise' tab.
    • Click on the 'Add Row' button to add a new row for Enterprise pricing.
    • Enter the details for Enterprise pricing, such as features and cost.
    • Click "Publish" or "Update" to save.
  5. Medium Pricing:
    • Click on the 'Medium' tab.
    • Click on the 'Add Row' button to add a new row for Medium pricing.
    • Enter the details for Medium pricing, such as features and cost.
    • Click "Publish" or "Update" to save.
  6. Small Pricing:
    • Click on the 'Small' tab.
    • Click on the 'Add Row' button to add a new row for Small pricing.
    • Enter the details for Small pricing, such as features and cost.
    • Click "Publish" or "Update" to save.

docs.title: Edit Pricing Details
docs.text:
1. Edit Pricing Rows:

  2. To edit existing pricing details, navigate to the respective tab ('Enterprise', 'Medium', or 'Small') within the 'Pricing' page editor.

  3. Click on the pricing row you want to edit.
  4. Modify the content and details as needed.
  5. Click "Update" to save your changes.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This tutorial will guide you through adding, editing, and deleting three types of resources—Datasheets, Whitepapers, and Blogs—using WordPress CMS in Prospectory.ai website.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Access to a WordPress website with administrator privileges.
  • Basic familiarity with WordPress administration and content management.

docs.title: Add a Datasheet
docs.text:
1. Go to Datasheets > Add New.
  2. Enter the title of the datasheet in the title field.
  3. Enter detailed content about the datasheet in the main content area.
  4. Optionally, add a brief summary in the Excerpt field.
  5. Upload a Featured Image for visual representation.
  6. Click "Publish" to make the datasheet live on your website.

docs.title: Add a Whitepaper
docs.text:
1. Follow the same steps as adding a Datasheet, but categorize it as a Whitepaper.
  2. Provide relevant content, excerpt, and featured image.
  3. Click "Publish" to make the whitepaper live on your website.

docs.title: Add a Blog Post
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Blogs > Add New.
  2. Enter a title for your blog post.
  3. Write the content of your blog post.
  4. Add an excerpt if desired.
  5. Upload a featured image.
  6. Click "Publish" to make the blog post live on your website.

docs.title: Edit a Datasheet, Whitepaper, or Blog Post
docs.text:
1. Navigate either Datasheet, Whitepaper or Blogs and find the post you want to edit.
  2. Click on the post title to open the editor.
  3. Make necessary changes to the title, content, excerpt, or featured image.
  4. Click "Update" to save your changes.

docs.title: Delete a Datasheet, Whitepaper, or Blog Post
docs.text:
1. Navigate either Datasheet, Whitepaper or Blogs.
  2. Hover over the post you want to delete.
  3. Click on "Trash" to move the post to the trash.
  4. To permanently delete, go to Trash, hover over the post, and click "Delete Permanently."

docs.title: Navigating to the Pages Section
docs.text: To update content on various pages, follow these steps:

docs.title: Locate and Edit the Home Page
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Pages Section:

  2. Go to the WordPress Admin Dashboard.

  3. Locate the left-hand menu.

  4. Click on Pages to access a list of all pages on your website.

  5. Finding the Home Page:

  6. Look for the page titled Homepage. If your home page has a different title, find the page corresponding to your homepage content.

  7. Editing the Home Page:

  8. Hover over the title of the home page.
  9. Click the Edit link that appears below the page title.
  10. On the edit page, update content for each section as needed. This includes modifying text, uploading images, or adding button links.

Note: These steps apply to editing other pages as well.

docs.title: Page Templates
docs.text:
Each page on your website uses a specific page template to control its layout and functionality. Here are the common templates:

  • Default Template: Standard layout for most pages.
  • Custom Template: Offers unique layouts or functionality tailored for specific content types.
  • Dynamic Page Template: Ideal for adding new custom pages with dynamic content.

To use the Dynamic Page Template:

  1. Select Add New under Pages.
  2. Choose Template from the page attributes.
  3. Select Dynamic Page Template to create a page with dynamic content.

These templates help maintain consistency and enhance functionality across different sections of your website.

docs.title: Features Page (New Dynamic Sections)
docs.text: I have updated the implementation of the dynamic sections on the feature page. Instead of statically updating the content, we now utilize a dynamic repeater for sections, allowing you to add data dynamically. Please refer to the image below for references.

docs.title: Steps to Edit the Logo
docs.text:
1. In the WordPress Admin Dashboard, go to Appearance > Customize.
  2. In the Customizer, navigate to the Logo section.

docs.title: Uploading Different Logo Options
docs.text:
1. Dark Logo: Click the Select Image button under the Dark Logo section to upload or change the logo for dark themes.
  2. Light Logo: Click the Select Image button under the Light Logo section to upload or change the logo for light themes.
  3. Footer Logo: Click the Select Image button under the Footer Logo section to upload or change the logo for the footer.

docs.title: Saving Your Changes
docs.text:
1. After uploading the logos, click the Publish button at the top of the Customizer to save your changes.
  2. Visit your website to ensure the new logos are displayed correctly.

docs.title: Steps to Edit the Menus
docs.text:
1. In the WordPress Admin Dashboard, go to Appearance > Menus.
  2. If there is more than one menu, select the menu you want to edit from the dropdown menu and click Select.

docs.title: Main Header Menu
docs.text:
1. Adding Items to the Main Header Menu:
  2. On the left side, you will see different sections like Pages, Posts, Custom Links, and Categories.
  3. Check the box next to the items you want to add to the menu.
  4. Click the Add to Menu button. The items will appear at the bottom of the menu structure on the right side.
  5. Organizing Menu Items:
  6. To rearrange items, simply drag and drop them into the desired order.
  7. To create a submenu (dropdown menu), drag an item slightly to the right under another item.
  8. Removing Items from the Menu:
  9. To remove an item, click the down arrow next to the item.
  10. Click the Remove link.
  11. Saving Your Changes:
  12. After making the necessary changes, click the Save Menu button.
  13. Visit your website to ensure the menu changes are displayed correctly.

docs.title: Main Footer Menu
docs.text:
1. Adding Items to the Main Footer Menu:
  2. On the left side, you will see different sections like Pages, Posts, Custom Links, and Categories.
  3. Check the box next to the items you want to add to the menu.
  4. Click the Add to Menu button. The items will appear at the bottom of the menu structure on the right side.
  5. Organizing Menu Items:
  6. To rearrange items, simply drag and drop them into the desired order.
  7. To create a submenu (dropdown menu), drag an item slightly to the right under another item.
  8. Removing Items from the Menu:
  9. To remove an item, click the down arrow next to the item.
  10. Click the Remove link.
  11. Saving Your Changes:
  12. After making the necessary changes, click the Save Menu button.
  13. Visit your website to ensure the menu changes are displayed correctly.

docs.title: Steps to Edit Social Media Links
docs.text:
1. In the WordPress Admin Dashboard, go to Appearance > Customize.
  2. In the Customizer, navigate to the Social Media Links section.

docs.title: Adding or Updating Social Media Links
docs.text:
1. LinkedIn URL: Enter the URL for your LinkedIn profile or page.
  2. Twitter URL: Enter the URL for your Twitter profile.
  3. Facebook URL: Enter the URL for your Facebook page.
  4. YouTube URL: Enter the URL for your YouTube channel.
  5. TikTok URL: Enter the URL for your TikTok profile.
  6. Instagram URL: Enter the URL for your Instagram profile.

docs.title: Saving Your Changes
docs.text:
1. After entering the URLs, click the Publish button at the top of the Customizer to save your changes.
  2. Visit your website to ensure the social media links are displayed correctly.
